intro: Ozothamnus reticulatus, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It has a compact, bushy growth habit and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Ozothamnus reticulatus is also used in traditional Indigenous practices and has some medicinal uses.
